definition: to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion

sentences.english: The zoomable eyeball camera is still, however, in its early stages.
sentences.chinese: 目前可變焦眼球攝像頭仍是一個實驗室產品。

sentences.english: They offer sharpness that zoom lenses cannot touch.
sentences.chinese: 它們提供變焦鏡頭不能達到的清晰度。

sentences.english: They also offer built-in motion detection and 16-camera premium software.
sentences.chinese: 它們還內置移動監測和16倍變焦鏡頭付費軟件。

sentences.english: Perhaps there’ll be 16GB telephoto or 32GB zoom lenses available in the future.
sentences.chinese: 也許在將來會有16GB的遠焦或32GB變焦鏡頭。

sentences.english: In addition, the mechanical zoom system is restricted to magnifying the area on-axis.
sentences.chinese: 再者，機械式變焦系統受限於同軸區域的放大。

sentences.english: All zoom , focus, and lens shift adjustments are manual.
sentences.chinese: 所有的變焦，聚焦和鏡頭移動調整手冊。

sentences.english: The recorder can also control pan-tilt-zoom cameras.
sentences.chinese: 錄音機還可以控制泛傾斜變焦照相機。

sentences.english: The rather small rubberized focus ring operates very smooth.
sentences.chinese: 窄窄的橡膠變焦環轉動非常順滑。

sentences.english: It also features pan-tilt-zoom control, alarm management, and activity direction.
sentences.chinese: 它還有變焦控制，報警管理和活動監測。

sentences.english: "Ultrazoom" cameras pack in telephoto lenses that once would have required their own cases.
sentences.chinese: 一些“超變焦”照相機擁有獨配的長焦鏡頭。
